intro: Nasturtium brevistylon, commonly known as the short-stemmed nasturtium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Tropaeolaceae and is characterized by its vibrant orange and yellow flowers. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and has a climbing or trailing growth habit. Its flowers are not only ornamental but also edible, with a peppery taste similar to watercress. Nasturtium brevistylon is often used in gardens for its aesthetic value and pest-repelling properties.
